title: Data Analytics and Information Systems
shortTagline: Link data analytics and information systems with financial reporting.
overview: Introduces data analytics and information systems concepts for accounting, including systems components, information quality, data modelling, infrastructure, internal controls, risk, and reporting systems.

skills: use of data for financial reporting

title: Computerized Accounting
shortTagline: Hands on work with accounting software and full cycle bookkeeping.
overview: Covers company setup, full cycle accounting, GST and PST, payroll, foreign currency, budgeting, project costing, inventory, and reconciliations using computerized accounting tools.
region: Northern British Columbia (Cariboo, Nechako, Prince George)

title: Audit and Assurance
shortTagline: Foundations of audit and assurance work with a focus on risk and controls.
overview: Covers the audit process, internal controls, audit evidence, materiality, risk, independence, ethics, audit data analytics, and audit reporting from planning through documentation.
region: Northern British Columbia (Cariboo, Nechako, Prince George)

title: Management Information Systems
shortTagline: How organizations use information systems to support decisions and operations.
overview: Introduces how organizations use information systems to support decisions, strengthen operations, improve security, and enhance performance, including decision support, e business, business intelligence, networks, enterprise systems, and AI enabled tools.
region: Northern British Columbia (Cariboo, Nechako, Prince George)

title: Project Management Essentials
shortTagline: PMBOK aligned tools for planning and managing projects.
overview: Provides PMBOK based tools and techniques across the project life cycle, including scheduling, scope, budgeting, risk management, resource planning, and evaluation, with simulations and case projects. Also satisfies PMP exam project management education hours.

title: Human Resource Management
shortTagline: Core HR concepts for staffing and supporting people in organizations.
overview: Covers staffing, workforce planning, job evaluation, performance management, compensation, health and safety, and labour relations with a focus on HR's role in project environments and organizational change.

title: Organizational Behaviour
shortTagline: How individuals and teams behave and perform at work.
overview: Introduces individual and group behaviour in workplaces, including motivation, leadership, communication, teamwork, culture, decision making, and conflict, with application to business and small organization settings.

title: Finance 1
shortTagline: Fundamental finance concepts and financial literacy for business.
overview: Covers foundational finance concepts and financial literacy for business decision making, including the time value of money, basic financial analysis, and interpreting financial information.

title: Business Statistics
shortTagline: Use data and statistics to support business decisions.
overview: Focuses on applied statistics for business, including descriptive measures, probability concepts, and data informed decisions that support analysis in finance, marketing, and operations.

title: Financial Accounting
shortTagline: Core accounting cycle and financial statement preparation.
overview: Introduces the accounting cycle, financial reporting, and the preparation and interpretation of basic financial statements used by small businesses and organizations.

shortTagline: Fundamental marketing concepts for products, services, and ideas.

title: Fundamentals of Business

shortTagline: Plan and execute small projects that improve hospitality operations.
